exercise.instructions:
In the previous exercise we learned how to use single line comments. What if we want to comment out multiple lines?
One way is to start every line with a '#'.
In addition, Python allows us to comment out a section of multiple lines by putting ' """ ' at the beginning and the end of the section.
exercise.code: def printNameWithComment(name): """ enter your comments here """ print #enter your code here return

task.content: Add a multi line comments to describe your implementation.
